author: Gemmadeen
body:
I’ve been on metformin for a few years but it didn’t seem to help much. My a1c on 6/13/22 was 9.2. 

I started Ozempic for my type 2 on 7/12/22 (I have titrated up to 1 mg). My a1c last week (10/26) was 6.0. 

It’s worked amazingly well for my blood sugars. The weight loss is definitely an added bonus. I’ve gone from 295.1lbs to 252.8 lbs in the 15 weeks since I’ve started. 
Not having my sugars all over the place has been incredible. I don’t feel tired all the time or ravenously hungry.

author: ravenclawshorts
body: I do. My A1C went from a 9.8 to a 5.4 in 6 months. I started august 2020. Last time I did labs was about 6 months ago and I was at 5.2. Lost 60 lbs as well.

author: Nnymeria
body: Did your doctor continue your prescription or did you come off of it now that you've reached a good A1C?

author: ravenclawshorts
body: I am still on it. The weight started to creep back up earlier this year so the dr upped me to the 2mg shot. I was only able to fill it twice due to the shortage so I’m back at 1mg but it helped me lose the weight I regained. If I were to come off Ozempic my weight and A1C would likely skyrocket so I suspect I will be a lifer.

author: anonymiz123
body: Yes, but I’m still on Metformin. Together, they work better than just one.

author: Lisawilksowen64
body: Thank you! I thought I was the only one on it for diabetes. It’s only been a month but so far I haven’t had any bad reactions. With the MetFormin I was always tired and hungry. Fingers crossed this works.

author: LeiLaniGranny
body: I'm on .25 which is keeping me in check so far. Dr. is thrilled 😁

author: DazzlingBuffalo6608
body: Yes, DM2 for 30 years. Metformin, Jardiance, 0.75Ozempic. Basaglar and Admelog.

author: ProfessionalWorker38
body: I have type 2.. Just recently prescribed Ozempic... took my first dose last week. I'm also obese so it's a duel drug for me. I also still take Metformin. Had nausea for a few days, and today I didn't have any. So I ate a crap load of food. We will see about the weight loss. I need to lose over 100 pounds...

author: Similar_River6750
body: How can u eat a lot without feeling nauseous ? As soon as I overdo my food even one μ - I feel like crap.

author: ProfessionalWorker38
body: I don't know, but the nausea has gone away. I take my next dose Tuesday. I've got to work on my diet.  3 more doses until I raise it to .5 mg.

author: Similar_River6750
body:
2 more for me …
All the best

author: FamousConversation38
body: I have Type 2. I take 1500mg of Metformin and .50mg of Ozempic. It has helped the weight come off faster for sure, but the best part of Ozempic is what it's done for my blood sugar. My fasting sugar was running in the 150s when I started Ozempic and now are under 110. Still higher than I'd like, but they should go down more with more weight loss. I don't have spikes after eating anymore, even on carb heavier meals. My a1c was 10 about two weeks before I Oz. My doctor and I think it will be well under 7 at my next appointment based on my current glucose readings. Amazing, amazing drug for Type 2.

author: Selynia23
body: Yup

author: Similar_River6750
body: My values dropped immediately between 5.x to 6.x  from an average 8 - I don‘t have even peaks anymore

author: RollTideLucy
body: I am.  Also on Toujeo.  Started off on Humalog and Toujeo. Doc switched me to Ozempic and Toujeo.  Hoping she takes me off Toujeo next week.  No more ups and down.  Weight is SLOWLY coming off for me (frustrating part).

author: Hot_Sell4061
body: my dad! exactly this case, was on metformin

author: SouthernGentATL
body: Ozempic and Synjardy for T2. Non insulin dependent. A1C is sticking around 5.0.

author: ManOnTime
body: Semaglutide (Ozempic) was specifically created to treat Type 2 Diabetes, so theoretically unless it's specifically being prescribed off-label for weight loss instead of Wegovy, which is indicated for that use, everyone on it should be Type 2.

author: KeyWestJuanita
body: Type 2 here. They lowered my metformin when they saw the Ozempic was working. I go back next month hoping to get off metformin for good!

author: Nerdnursern
body:
T2DM here METf. started march, added ozempic may. A1C  went from 7.2 in may to 4.8 last week.

male 36, 5’ 10" start weight 304, current weight 239.

I only  take metformin if I eat, or have a protein smoothie or something. Some times I dont Really eat for 24, 48, hours, so I don’t take it to prevent lows.

author: According_North_1056
body:
Me! I didn’t like taking metformin. I took it for years but then once when I had one of my surgeries, bariatric surgery actually, I was taken off of it. Well, I was hoping that I was going to lose enough with the gastric sleeve that it would help get me off some of my meds anyway. Alas, I struggled still so eventually I went and talked to the endocrinologist again and they put me on Victoza and then Ozempic.  I was on victoza and then trulicity then another major surgery and I couldn’t take the victoza…then eventually I went back on victoza and then Ozempic. My weight loss has been minimal, 5-8 pounds, depending on the day and I have been on it for months. 

However, it keeps my blood sugar evened out. I think my A1C was fairly decent this last time but not as good as we want it to be plus I have a lot of hypoglycemic lows and eventually Ozempic leveled out that and the highs.

Edit: I worked up to 2mg about four weeks ago. But we are going to change it to Mourjurno (spelling) after I use what I have left because of the shortage. It’s too hard to have it on back order - stop taking it and even taking it a few days later then the nausea starts all over again.

author: ardnek77
body: I was on metformin and it caused me a lot of gastrointestinal symptoms. My doctor saw that I was exercising and eating properly- really trying to get healthier- and suggested ozempic. I haven't lost weight rapidly but I am losing slowly. I work out daily.  I know I'm not eating enough but I'm working on it. No processed food, no added sugar, no sugar alcohols, very limited gluten. About 9 months ago my A1C was 11 and the neuropathy in my feet started. Just had my blood work done and my A1C was 7. I'm glad that I have ozempic as a tool to help me. It's much easier to make the smart food choices when my hunger is suppressed. I used to mindlessly, constantly eat.

author: Fun_Butterscotch_953
body: My a1c went from 12.6 to 6.3 in 4 months. It has been uncontrollable for years. Ozempic is literally saving my life. I've lost 17 lbs so far but I really didn't have much to lose. I still take my metformin and find if I stop taking it my numbers start creeping up. This is my 5th month. I've never been a big eater but with ozempic I find myself having to remember to eat. Good luck with your a1c
